tvshowdetails.label: Smallville
tvshowdetails.plot: Before the Legend...Before the Icon...He was a teenager growing up in Smallville, troiugh his tumultuous teen years to Clark Kentâ€™s final steps toward embracing his destiny as the Man of Steel.
tvshowdetails.title: Smallville

1.label: 1x01. Pilot
1.plot: Rescue Lex, avoid Lana's killer green necklace, stop an avenging scarecrow man and don't reveal your powers to anyone. Who says being a teen hero is easy? Clark also learns he's not exactly from the neighborhood.
1.title: Pilot

1.label: 1x02. Metamorphosis
1.plot: Is Lana fated to a cocoon of doom? A nerdish bug collector is transformed into a monster by the irradiated bugs of Smallville - and he wants Lana for his bug-world queen.
1.title: Metamorphosis

1.label: 1x03. Hothead
1.plot: He has a burning desire for victory! A win-at-any-cost football coach turn deadly when unexpected exposure to Kryptonite gives him the power to cause his critics to be engulfed in flames.
1.title: Hothead

1.label: 1x04. X-Ray
1.plot: Clark is startled to discover he has the power of X-ray vision - a power that may be useful when he confronts a changeling-like student who can take on the appearance and emotional traits of anyone.
1.title: X-Ray

1.label: 1x05. Cool
1.plot: He's the coolest guy in school - and a stone-cold danger to everyone he meets. A fall into icy, Kryptonite laced Crater Lake turns a student into a hypothermic monster who seeks to rob others of their body heat.
1.title: Cool

1.label: 1x06. Hourglass
1.plot: A plunge into Kryptonite-infused waters acts like a fountain of youth for a retirement home resident, who is restored to the murderous ways of his sinister past. A fortune-teller foresees Lex in the Oval Office.
1.title: Hourglass

1.label: 1x07. Craving
1.plot: A teen's amazingly successful weight-loss regimen gives her a crazed hunger for high-fat munchies! So she munches on a deer here, a boyfriend there - she's a fat-sucking fiend and a menace to all Smallville!
1.title: Craving

1.label: 1x08. Jitters
1.plot: An ex-LutherCorp employee insists that the spasmodic rages that sometimes grip him are the result of an incident that occurred on the plant's secret Level 3. But if there is a Level 3, why doesn't Lex know anything about it?
1.title: Jitters

1.label: 1x09. Rogue
1.plot: The secret is out - perhaps. Clark performs a lifesaving act of super heroism, thinking there are no witnesses. But a nearby cop sees everything, and he has blackmail in mind.
1.title: Rogue

1.label: 1x10. Shimmer
1.plot: A servant is supposed to be invisible to his employers. But someone at Lex's mansion takes that axiom literally when he uses an invisibility potion to cloak himself during a minor-wide terror spree.
1.title: Shimmer

1.label: 1x11. Hug
1.plot: His Kryptonite-infused handshake seals the deal! A manipulative, wheeler-dealer entrepreneur exerts a mysterious power over Smallville residents - and even convinces Clark's dad to sell the family farm.
1.title: Hug

1.label: 1x12. Leech
1.plot: Let's see how the other 99.999999% live. After a fluke lightning strike, Clark experiences the joys and pains of a normal human existence, and a classmate suddenly has the powers once wielded by Clark.
1.title: Leech

1.label: 1x13. Kinetic
1.plot: Whitney falls in with the wrong crowd - ex-jocks turned thieves whose Kryptonite-saturated tattoos alter their molecular structure so that they can pass through walls... and rob banks and Lex's mansion with ease.
1.title: Kinetic

1.label: 1x14. Zero
1.plot: A nemesis presumed to be dead for three years resurfaces in Smallville and stalks Lex. Chloe uncovers intriguing information about Clark's adoption.
1.title: Zero

1.label: 1x15. Nicodemus
1.plot: Jonathan turns against his son, Lana becomes a sexy flirt and Pete sets out to settle a score with Lex. They all exhibit unusual behavior after coming into contact with a strange, toxic flower - and there appears to be no antidote to the flower's poison.
1.title: Nicodemus

1.label: 1x16. Stray
1.plot: A child who can read minds escapes his cruel parents and finds happiness with the Kents. But that joy may be brief when his parents come looking for the boy so they can use his psychic gifts in a life of crime.
1.title: Stray

1.label: 1x17. Reaper
1.plot: Angel of mercy or deaths? After a Kryptonite-related incident gives a young man the ability to kill via mere touch, he sets out to use his newfound power on people who are gravely ill.
1.title: Reaper

1.label: 1x18. Drone
1.plot: Running on a platform of "truth, justice and... other stuff," Clark vies for class president. But a beekeeping rival contender vows Clark and the other aspirants will feel the sting of her candidacy.
1.title: Drone

1.label: 1x19. Crush
1.plot: After a hit-and-run accident that destroys his drawing hand, a cartoonist is left with bitterness, pain... and an unexpected gift of telekinesis that he turns into an instrument of revenge.
1.title: Crush

1.label: 1x20. Obscura
1.plot: Lana has eerie visions involving a kidnapping of Chloe. Lex's ongoing inquiry into the mystery surrounding Clark takes an intriguing turn when a crop duster reveals what he saw fall from the sky during the Smallville meteor shower.
1.title: Obscura

1.label: 1x21. Tempest
1.plot: A reporter closes in on Clark's secret; Chloe may depart Smallville; LuthorCorp is forced to close. At least the school dance will provide carefree moments for Clark and his friends. Then the twister hits.
1.title: Tempest

2.label: 2x01. Vortex (2)
2.plot: Clark rescues Lana from the storm, but discovers that the spaceship is released, while Jonathan is buried alive with the unscrupulous reporter who discovered Clark's secret. Meanwhile, Lex is wracked with guilt over his critically injured father.
2.title: Vortex (2)

2.label: 2x02. Heat
2.plot: Clark gains a new power - heat-vision. As he struggles to control it, Lex gets married to the new Smallville High teacher, Desiree Atkins, little does he know that she not only has an alterior motive, but that she's coming on to Clark too.
2.title: Heat

2.label: 2x03. Duplicity
2.plot: Pete finds Clark's spaceship, forcing Clark to reveal his secret to his best friend. Dr. Hamilton is plagued by kryptonite-fueled illness and focuses on Pete. Meanwhile, Lana has to deal with Nell and her plans to remarry while Lex and Lionel adjust to life together.
2.title: Duplicity

2.label: 2x04. Red
2.plot: Clark has his first run-in with red kryptonite in this exploration of classic Superman mythology, turning immoral when he gets his high-school ring holding a piece of rock. Meanwhile, Lex and his father have some issues to resolve when Lionel starts taking over the manor.
2.title: Red

2.label: 2x05. Nocturne
2.plot: Lana has a new stalker - a boy imprisoned in his basement by his parents who sneaks out at night to visit her. Meanwhile Lionel hires Clark's mother as his personal assistant.
2.title: Nocturne

2.label: 2x06. Redux
2.plot: Martha's father William comes to town after many years of estrangement due do his disapproval of Jonathan. Meanwhile Clark must deal with a series of old-age deaths at Smallville High, and the new principal puts his foot down.
2.title: Redux

2.label: 2x07. Lineage
2.plot: A strange woman shows up claiming to be Clark's biological mother...and that his father is Lionel. Meanwhile Lana decides to meet with the man who is her biological father.
2.title: Lineage

2.label: 2x08. Ryan
2.plot: Ryan (from "Stray") returns and Clark has to save him from Dr. Garner of the Summerholt Research Facility. Meanwhile, Aunt Nell leaves Smallville, and Lex wants to expand the plant but runs afoul of the mayor.
2.title: Ryan

2.label: 2x09. Dichotic
2.plot: A Smallville student, Ian, displays the ability to make clones of himself and uses his power to date both Chloe and Lana. Meanwhile Lex goes to anger management class and meets an attractive local doctor.
2.title: Dichotic

2.label: 2x10. Skinwalker
2.plot: Clark becomes involved with a Native American woman, Kyla, and becomes aware of ancient Indian prophecy that warns of a man of great powers who fell from the sky. Worse, a wolflike creature is attacking the local Lexcorp construction project, and Martha and Lionel may be the next victims.
2.title: Skinwalker

2.label: 2x11. Visage
2.plot: Whitney returns to Smallville, eager to start back up where he left off with Lana. But everything isn't what it seems...
2.title: Visage

2.label: 2x12. Insurgence
2.plot: Lex hires some thugs to bug Lionel's office but things get out of control when Lionel and Martha are taken hostage, and Clark must rescue them without revealing his secrets.
2.title: Insurgence

2.label: 2x13. Suspect
2.plot: Lionel is shot in the manor, and Jonathan is the prime suspect.
2.title: Suspect

2.label: 2x14. Rush
2.plot: Students are engaging in wild, sometimes suicidal stunts, and Chloe and Pete are the next ones to become "infected."..and they use a piece of red meteor rock to get Clark to join them.
2.title: Rush

2.label: 2x15. Prodigal
2.plot: Lex recovers his long-lost brother Lucas and uses him in a ploy to buy out his father's share of the company. But it soon becomes clear that Lucas isn't to be trusted, and Lex soon finds himself ousted from his own company.
2.title: Prodigal

2.label: 2x16. Fever
2.plot: Martha catches a lungful of kryptonite-irradiated spores and a weakened Clark is her only hope for survival.
2.title: Fever

2.label: 2x17. Rosetta
2.plot: Clark travels to New York to meet Dr. Swann, a brilliant scientist who holds a message for Clark from his home planet. Meanwhile Lana decides to move out of Chloe's house after they get into an argument about Clark.
2.title: Rosetta

2.label: 2x18. Visitor
2.plot: After a schoolmate claims to be an alien and proves it by using heat vision, Clark investigates and believes the boy is from Krypton. Meanwhile, Helen confronts Lex over the locked room in the mansion that holds his investigation of Clark's secrets.
2.title: Visitor

2.label: 2x19. Precipice
2.plot: After Lana is almost assaulted by a college student, Clark injures the boy while helping her. When the Kents are sued for damages that could cost them the farm, Clark tries to find a way out of the lawsuit. Meanwhile, Helen's obsessive ex-boyfriend comes to Smallville to win her back but when she turns him down, he stabs her, prompting Lex to take the law into his own hands.
2.title: Precipice

2.label: 2x20. Witness
2.plot: Clark runs up against super-strong robbers who are apparently tied to LexCorp. And Chloe begins to ally with Lionel, while Lana and Henry Small bond.
2.title: Witness

2.label: 2x21. Accelerate
2.plot: Lana is haunted by the ghost of a dead friend, Emily, but the "spirit" has connections to Lionel Luthor, who is also scheming to get control of the Indian caves and "help" Lex with his wedding.
2.title: Accelerate

2.label: 2x22. Calling (1)
2.plot: Dr. Walden comes out of a coma with super-powers and a desire to kill Clark, piquing the Luthors' interest. The spaceship starts talking to Clark, and Helen and Lex prepare for their wedding.
2.title: Calling (1)

2.label: 2x23. Exodus (2)
2.plot: A sense of foreboding surrounds Smallville as Clark must choose between staying with Lana and his family or fulfilling his destiny to rule the Earth. Lex and Helen prepare for their marriage, and Chloe considers Lionel's offer to investigate Clark.
2.title: Exodus (2)
